description.narrative: Den föreslagna påfyllnaden av Zim-fonden om 20 MSEK kommer att bidra till att den avslutande delen av projektets fas 2 kommer att till en större del finansieras. Danmark fyller på fonden med ca 19 MUSD och Sverige i o m den föreslagna påfyllnaden ca 3 MUSD. AfDB/MMU har initialt föreslagit för Project Oversight Committee (POC) att använda tillgänglig finansiering till att fullfinansiera hela projektet avseende vatten & sanitet phase 2 (stage 1 och 2), och låta elektrifieringsprojektet agera dragspel där resterande medel (knappa 3 MUSD) används för prioriterade insatser inom EPIRP phase 2. Eventuella ytterligare givarmedel får då allokeras till EPIRP upp till den budgeterade nivån om 17,5 MUSD för den avslutande fas 2 av EPIRP. Slutligt beslut om fördelning av tillgängliga medel i fas 2 avses tas först vid fondens styrelsemöte (Project Oversight Committee, POC) i december 2014 och bekräftas i samband med AfDBs nästa styrelsemöte (ca februari 2015). Urgent Water Supply and Sanitation Rahabilitation Project (UWSSRP) phase 2 avser färdigställa påbörjade rehabiliteringsarbeten av vatten- och sanitetsanläggningar i Harare, Ruwa, Chitungwiza och Redcliff. Projektet inkluderar arbete för förändrade beteenden avseende hygien, kapacitetesbyggande (bla utarbetande av investeringsplaner, utbildning) samt projektadministration. Emergency Power Infrastructure Rehabilitation Project (EPIRP) phase 2 planerar med en begränsad finansiering arbeta med miljöåtgärder avseende Hwange Power Plant.
Multi-Donor Trust Fund administered by the African Development Bank for funding of projects for rehabilitation of water supply and sanitation services and the electric power sector.

UWSSRP:Impact objective: Improved quality of life. Outcome objective: 1. Improved availability of water supply in the project areas. 2. Raw sewage removed from residential areas and treatment capacity increased.3. Financial sustainability and performance of sector in the project areas improved. EPIRP:Impact objective: The power production capability of the installed capacity fully restored with due attention to environmental safety & protection. Outcome objective:1. Access to reliable electricity supply2. Improved environmental quality at Hwange Power Plant and surroundings.

sector.narrative: Water supply and sanitation - large systems

tag.narrative: 6.a - By 2030, expand international cooperation and capacity-building support to developing countries in water- and sanitation-related activities and programmes, including water harvesting, desalination, water efficiency, wastewater treatment, recycling and reuse technologies.

6.a - Till 2030 utöka det internationella samarbetet och stödet för kapacitetsuppbyggnad till utvecklingsländerna inom vatten- och sanitetsrelaterade verksamheter och program, inklusive genom tekniker för vatteninsamling, avsaltning, vatteneffektivitet, rening av avloppsvatten, återvinning och återanvändning.

7.b - By 2030, expand infrastructure and upgrade technology for supplying modern and sustainable energy services for all in developing countries, in particular least developed countries, small island developing States and landlocked developing countries, in accordance with their respective programmes of support.

7.b - Till 2030 bygga ut infrastrukturen och uppgradera tekniken för att leverera moderna och hållbara energitjänster till alla i utvecklingsländerna, i synnerhet de minst utvecklade länderna och små önationer under utveckling.

policy-marker.narrative: Aid Targeting the Objectives of the Convention on Biological Diversity
Aid Targeting the Objectives of the Convention to Combat Desertification
Aid Targeting the Objectives of the Framework Convention on Climate Change - Adaptation
Aid Targeting the Objectives of the Framework Convention on Climate Change - Mitigation
Reproductive, Maternal, Newborn and Child Health (RMNCH)

description.narrative: The Zimfund project was supposed to be completed in October 2019. During 2019, however, the project requested a no-cost-extension to complete some of the planned activities including consolidation works. The no-cost-extension was granted by the donors and the project is now scheduled to end on the 31st October 2020. During 2019, the Emergency Power Infrastructure Rehabilitation Project Phase II (EPIRP II) Stage I was completed and the grant was fully utilized. All the works contracts were transitioned into a one-year defects liability period. The project's performance was satisfactory and it achieved most of the development objectives set for the Phase II stage 1. Implementation of the EPIRP Phase II Stage II continued in 2020 but the activies were not completed within the year, hence the request for the time extension. The implementation of the Power Consolidation Works commenced in the fourth quarter 2019. Under the EPIRP, the outcome objective of access to reliable electricity supply was achieved in the sense that the upgraded infrastructure was mainly for transmission of power and not generation and to this end, areas that would not not receive power due to obsolete and faulty infrastructure are now able to receive power when its generated. The areas are no longer excluded. During the year, the Urgent Water Supply and Sanitation Rehabilitation Project (UWSSRPII) was completed with a satisfactory performance rating. The project is being implemented in Chitungwiza, Chegutu, Kwekwe, Masvingo, and Mutare urban municipalities. Under the agreement, there is need for consolidation works in these municipalities. The required time for these works, which began in quarter four of the year, spills into 2020 but within the granted time extension. Furthermore, rehabilitation of Outfall Sewers in Chitungwiza Project was approved by the POC (USD 0.91million) and by the end of the year processing of the approval of the release of the grant had commenced with anticipation to start work in early 2020.
No indicator available - only a description of the activity results is published
